question: In my work environment, it is most important to me...

optionA.text: To help co-workers and to be in a peaceful environment.

optionB.text: To feel that my co-workers admire me and to be free from rigid rules.

optionC.text: o know exactly what is expected of me and to finish one task before moving to another.

optionD.text: To get things done and to see results.

question: When someone offers an opinion or conclusion and I disagree, I am most likely to...
When I am working on a team and we encounter a difficulty of some kind, I am most likely to say...

optionA.text: Lighten up! Just go with the flow!

optionC.text: How do you feel? I'd like to make sure that everyone is comfortable.

optionD.text: Let's consider this more carefully? Do we have all of the data we need?

question: My attitude towards detail work — like research and data analysis — is most often...

optionA.text: Great. I enjoy research and analysis.

optionB.text: If it will get better and faster results, I'll do it

optionC.text: If it will make others think more highly of me, I'll do it.

optionD.text: If it will help other people or make things easier, I'll do it.
